intro: Licaria rodriguesii, commonly known as Rodrigues's licaria, is a flowering plant native to the island of Rodrigues in the Indian Ocean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or white. It thrives in coastal areas and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
